title: [Large-Scale] Language Proficiency Enhancement Program Utilizing Hybrid Flexible Learning Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language comprehension skills and fundamental digital device operation skills
context.additional_context: Participants face difficulties solving language-related real-world problems (e.g., official document writing, digital communication) in daily life. Flexible engagement is possible in a smartphone-centric learning environment.

learning_goals: Within four weeks, learners can apply language theories learned through flipped learning with 80% accuracy to solve given real-life problems.
Through action learning activities, learners collaborate with peers and instructors to propose language problem-solving strategies with 90% participation.
In a hybrid learning environment, learners can flexibly participate in online (mobile) and offline sessions with a minimum attendance rate of 75%.

resources: Real-Life Case Database for Language Problem Solving
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
